features.text:
### Cities are home to around 75% of the EU’s population and responsible for a large part of its energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions


### Producing more than **70% of global CO2 emissions**, cities play a pivotal role in achieving climate neutrality by 2050
features.title: third page
features.__generatedText__:
Cities are home to around 75% of the EU’s population and responsible for a large part of its energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions

Producing more than 70% of global CO2 emissions, cities play a pivotal role in achieving climate neutrality by 2050

features.text:
### 100 EU cities are taking actions to become climate neutral and smart cities by 2030 in the framework of EU Cities Mission. ### More than 200 European cities already lead by example with emission reduction plans that are more ambitious than their national governments.
### They are adapting policies, infrastructure, and making investments to become carbon negative rather than carbon neutral.
features.title: f
features.__generatedText__:
100 EU cities are taking actions to become climate neutral and smart cities by 2030 in the framework of EU Cities Mission.

More than 200 European cities already lead by example with emission reduction plans that are more ambitious than their national governments.

They are adapting policies, infrastructure, and making investments to become carbon negative rather than carbon neutral.

features.text:
Earth Observation (EO) can help to future-proof our cities by providing timely and actionable information to aid urban decision makers.

High resolution EO data can be used to map existing green roofs and photovoltaic systems mounted on roofs. EO can also be used to identify new suitable green and solar roofs.

EO can support the characterization of solar irradiation and provide insight into PV electric energy production potential of existing and future solar roofs.
features.title: EO
features.__generatedText__:
Earth Observation (EO) can help to future-proof our cities by providing timely and actionable information to aid urban decision makers.

High resolution EO data can be used to map existing green roofs and photovoltaic systems mounted on roofs. EO can also be used to identify new suitable green and solar roofs.

EO can support the characterization of solar irradiation and provide insight into PV electric energy production potential of existing and future solar roofs.

features.text:
Susanne Formanek, Director of GRUENSTATTGRAU GmbH, explains how green roofs can make cities more liveable for current and future generations.

Why are green roofs important?</br>
How can EO support the management of green Roofs?</br>
How does GTIF help manage green roofs?</br>
features.title: interview

Susanne Formanek, Director of GRUENSTATTGRAU GmbH, explains how green roofs can make cities more liveable for current and future generations.

Why are green roofs important?
How can EO support the management of green Roofs?
How does GTIF help manage green roofs?

features.text:
Scientists have developed a Green Roof Impact Score (GRIS), indicating the impact of retrofitting a house with a green roof

The score takes into account the surrounding greenness, as the vegetation cover in the area, and the Land Surface Temperatures retrieved by Sentinel-3

Inspecting the existing Green Roofs for each administrative unit, it is possible to have an estimate of the unused Potential Area for Green Roof

features.text: Land surface temperatures can directly be measured by different satellites and aid in the identification of regional planning measures mitigating heat in the urban core
